abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the China Third Henan
            Provincial Highway Project were as follows: outcomes for the
            first project were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satsifactory.
            Some lessons learned included: 1) in spite of a broad range
            of topics, complex issues and many stakeholders,
            institutional strengthening can be successful; 2) the Bank
            should pay more attention to the impact of the construction
            works on safety and include mitigations measures during the
            construction phase; 3) the impact of high cement content
            (above 4.5 percent in weight) in base course remains a
            problem; and 4) even though many provinces in China are
            using state of the art equipment, few provincial and
            municipal systems are well integrated.
